inclusion.criterion: Preoperative sonar and CT evidence of isolated splenic injuries
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Associated other abdominal or thoracic or neurological injuries detected preoperatively
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: successful nonoperative management, or successful embolization
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Previous upper abdominal surgery for laparoscopic approach
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Other abdominal injuries detected during surgery (liver,intestine and urinary bladder injuries)
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: 17-year-old boy with severe migratory pain in the right lower quadrant of his abdomen, nausea, vomiting, fever, tenderness, rebound tenderness, guarding on palpation, elevated WBC, dominant neutrophils, CT scan showing acute perforated appendicitis and diagnostic laparoscopy revealing phlegmon. Candidate for emergent laparoscopic appendectomy under general anesthesia.
